explanation: CD-ROM stores data. Read-only - cannot write. 650-700 MB capacity.

explanation: Motherboard connects CPU, RAM, storage, ports. Central hub of computer.
GPU handles graphics - display, gaming, video. Also used for AI/ML.
Heat sink draws heat away from processor. Often has fan. Prevents overheating.
PSU converts AC to DC. Powers motherboard, drives, components.
SMPS is efficient power supply. Used in PCs, laptops, chargers.

Port 80 is default for HTTP. Port 443 for HTTPS.

Port 25 is used for SMTP - sending email.
Malware is umbrella term - all malicious software types.
Antivirus uses signatures (known patterns) and behavior analysis.

Full backup copies all selected data. Incremental backs up only changes.

explanation: Incremental: only changes since last backup. Faster, uses less space.
